snippet: The ruling came as the House voted to extend another contested law connected to fighting terrorism, an expansion of warrantless surveillance.
abstract: Federal Judge Katherine B Forrest in New York issues a permanent injunction barring the government from relying on the National Defense Authorization Act to hold people in indefinite military detention, without trial, simply on suspicion that they substantially supported Al Qaeda or its allies; law was challenged by journalist Chris Hedges, who along with others argued that it chilled their constitutional rights by creating a basis to fear that their interactions with terrorist groups could end in their detention.
lead_paragraph: The ruling came as the House voted to extend another contested law connected to fighting terrorism, an expansion of warrantless surveillance.

headline.seo: Judge Blocks Controversial Indefinite Detention Law
headline.main: Judge Rules Against Law on Indefinite Detention
headline.print_headline: Judge Rules Against Law On Indefinite Detention
